abstract: Brazil's embattled sports minister Orlando Silva resigns amid accusations of corruption, reviving concern about Pres Dilma Rousseff's unstable governing coalition.
snippet: Orlando Silva, the sports minister of Brazil, resigned on Wednesday in response to a corruption scandal, reviving concern about President Dilma Rousseff’s unstable governing coalition.
lead_paragraph: Orlando Silva, the sports minister of Brazil, resigned on Wednesday in response to a corruption scandal, reviving concern about President Dilma Rousseff’s unstable governing coalition.

headline.print_headline: Sports Minister In Brazil Quits Under Pressure
headline.seo: Brazilian Sports Minister Resigns Under Pressure
